it.polimi.se2019.server.games

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.util.Observable<Response>
      • it.polimi.se2019.server.games.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<Response>, java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends Observable<Response>
implements Observer<Response>, java.io.Serializable
    This class contains data and logic of a game. In the MVC pattern this class implements a big chunk of the Model, the Observer pattern is used to communicate data updates to the view. This class also forwards the changes of other parts of the model lo the view.
    Author:
    Rodolfo Mariotti
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Use this constructor to initialize an empty game. It's used mainly for testing purposes.

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.List<Player> playerList)
        This constructor is used to initialize a Game. It's used by the Game Menager during the initialization of the game.
        Parameters:
        playerList - list of the players in the game

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.Date startDate,
            java.util.List<Player> playerList,
            Player currentPlayer,
            Board board,
            KillShotTrack killShotTrack,
            Deck<Weapon> weaponDeck,
            Deck<PowerUp> powerUpDeck,
            Deck<AmmoCrate> ammoCrateDeck,
            java.util.List<PowerUp> usedPowerUps,
            boolean frenzy,
            boolean frenzyActivatorEntered)
        This constructor should be used to resume a saved games. It let's you specify every attribute of the object.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the date when the game started
        playerList - the list of players in the game
        currentPlayer - the player who is playing his turn
        board - data structure used to manage the game map
        killShotTrack - used to track kills of the players
        weaponDeck - deck containing the cards that will spawn in weapon crates
        powerUpDeck - deck containing power up cards used by players to respawn and apply varius effects
        ammoCrateDeck - deck containing ammo cards that will spawn in ammo crates

    • Method Detail

      • initGameObjects

        public void initGameObjects(java.lang.String mapIndex)
        This method is used to setup various game attributes. It's used to avoid a bloated constructor. It's run by GameManager while setting up a new game.
        Parameters:
        mapIndex - the index of the map that will be initialized

      • updateTurn

        public void updateTurn()
        This method is used to handle every actions that mus be run between turns. It updates the value of current player to the next player and spawns used ammo crates and weapon crates.

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Getter method for the current player attribute.
        Returns:
        a reference to the currentPlayer

        Parameters:

        When this method is run the curren player will be set to the next player in the players list.

      • finalScoreUpdate

        public void finalScoreUpdate()
        This method is called at the end of the game by the model to update the scores of all player.

      • getRanking

        public java.util.List<Player> getRanking()
        This method is called at the end of the game by the Views to get a list of player sorted from the one with the higher score to the one with the lower.
        Returns:
        a sorted list of player (sorted for decreasing score)

      • getCurrentWeapon

        public Weapon getCurrentWeapon()
        Getter method for the currentWeapon attribute.
        Returns:
        reference to the current weapon of the game. It's the weapon that the player selected to use in this turn (can be set more than one time in a turn, in order to use different weapons).

      • setCurrentWeapon

        public void setCurrentWeapon(Weapon currentWeapon)
        Setter method for the currentWeapon attribute. Notifies registered observers.
        Parameters:
        currentWeapon - reference to the object that will be set as current weapon.

      • getCurrentActionUnitsList

        public java.util.List<ActionUnit> getCurrentActionUnitsList()
        Getter method for the currentActionUnitsList attribute.
        Returns:
        reference to the list of the action units executed during this turn

      • setCurrentActionUnitsList

        public void setCurrentActionUnitsList(java.util.List<ActionUnit> currentActionUnitsList)
        Setter method for the currentActionUnitsList attribute.
        Parameters:
        currentActionUnitsList - reference to the object that will be set as current action unit list of the game.

      • isFrenzy

        public boolean isFrenzy()
        Getter method for the frenzy attribute.
        Returns:
        true if the game is in frenzy mode, false otherwise

      • setFrenzy

        public void setFrenzy(boolean frenzy)
        This method is used to set the game in frenzy mode. The players will be divided in players before the frenzy activator and players after the frenzy activator; the value bar of the players without damage will be swapped.
        Parameters:
        frenzy - true to set the game in frenzy mode, false to unset frenzy mode

      • update

        public void update(Response response)
        This method is used to forward changes (requests) from other parts of the Model to the View.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer<Response>
        Parameters:
        response - change response (update) from other classes of the model.

      • getActionUnitTargetList

        public java.util.List<Targetable> getActionUnitTargetList(java.lang.String actionUnitName)
        Get the list of targets for the selected action.
        Parameters:
        actionUnitName - name of an action unit in the currentActionUnitsList
        Returns:
        target of the selected action
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are no action units with that name in currentActionUnitsList

        Returns:
        selected action unit
        Throws:

        Getter method for the cumulativeDamageTargetSet attribute.
        Returns:
        reference to the cumulativeDamageTargetSet of the game. Contains the set of the players damaged during this turn.

      • getVirtualPlayerPosition

        public Tile getVirtualPlayerPosition()
        Needed by the GrabPlayer action to access the player position before it's changed by the MovePlayerAction.run()
        Returns:
        the possible position of the current player at the end of the turn

        Gets the first player of the game.
        Returns:
        reference to the first player of the game

      • addDeath

        public void addDeath(Player player,
                     boolean overkill)
        This method is called when a player is killed. If the kill triggers frenzy mode the isFrenzy() method is called to set the game in frenzy mode.
        Parameters:
        player - reference to the killed player
        overkill - true if the player was killed by an overkill, false otherwise

      • discardPowerup

        public void discardPowerup(PowerUp powerUp)
        Discards a power up.
        Parameters:
        powerUp - power up to discard

      • discardWeapon

        public void discardWeapon(Weapon weapon)
        Discards a weapon card.
        Parameters:
        weapon - weapon card to discard

      • setLoaded

        public void setLoaded(Weapon weapon,
                      boolean state)
        Reload/unload the selected weapon. Notifies registered observers.
        Parameters:
        weapon - the weapon you want to reload/unload
        state - true if you want to reload the weapon, false if you want to unload it

      • setFrenzyActivatorEntered

        public void setFrenzyActivatorEntered(boolean frenzyActivatorEntered)
        Setter for frenzyActivatorEntered.
        Parameters:
        frenzyActivatorEntered - is a boolean parameter indicating if the frenzy activator player has ended his turn once, waiting for his last turn.

      • addMoveActionFailure

        public void addMoveActionFailure(java.lang.Boolean bool)
        This method adds a boolean to the moveActionFailure.
        Parameters:
        bool - value to add to the moveActionFailure attribute

      • needsMoveActionErrorMessage

        public boolean needsMoveActionErrorMessage()
        This method returns true if at least one value in moveActionFailures.
        Returns:
        true if the move action was successful, false otherwise

      • resetMoveActionFailure

        public void resetMoveActionFailure()
        This method resets the moveActionFailure.
